summary: PKR activity is regulated by a 58 kilo dalton cellular inhibitor (P58IPK) the protein is present in inactive state as a complex with Hsp40 under normal conditions. however the influenza virus component responsible for PKR inhibition through P58IPK activation was hitherto unknown. NP is the viral factor responsible for P58IPK activation and subsequent inhibition of PKR-mediated host response during IAV infection. PKR is tightly regulated by cellular inhibitors and often targeted by viral proteins [17]–[20]. NS1 of influenza virus directly binds to PKR and prevents its activation [21], [22]. PKR activity is also inhibited by a cellular 58 kDa protein, P58IPK. in nave cells, P58IPK exists in an inactive state in a complex with heat shock protein 40 (Hsp40), which becomes active upon release from this complex [28], [29]. expression of IAV NP in mammalian cells leads to reduced phosphorylation of PKR and its substrate eIF2. RNAi-mediated inhibition of NP expression in IAV infected cells enhanced the phosphorylation of PKR and its downstream substrate eIF2. HIV type 1 Nef protein interacts with Hsp40 to enhance viral gene expression. Hsp40 is also known to interact with the HBV core protein. heat shock proteins are known to affect viral replication of influenza viruses also. PKR phosphorylates eukaryotic translation initiation factor eIF2, which in phosphorylated state cannot participate in mRNA translation [12] another crucial host pathway which is activated by PKR is IRF3-mediated IFN production. viral NS1 protein is known to bind directly to PKR and inhibit its activation [20], [21]. NP-Hsp40 interaction was identified through a yeast two-hybrid screen. it was confirmed in transfected cells and in influenza virus infected cells. the interaction was found to be conserved across different influenza A viruses. NP and NS1 have similar effects on PKR mediated eIF2 phosphorylation. but their synergistic effect was higher than their individual effects. NP inhibition during IAV infection led to enhanced IRF3 phosphorylation. the effect of NP on IFN production is also reflected on virus replication. this effect may also be attributed to the essential requirement of NP for proper functioning of influenza virus polymerase. but the inhibitory action of NP on PKR-mediated host response may also contribute to the reduced virus replication in case of siRNA-mediated inhibition. ned in pGBK vector (Clontech) was used as bait and prey plasmids. full-length human Hsp40 gene was cloned into pGAD vector. colonies which grew on L-T-H- plates were considered positive. all virus infections were done at multiplicity of infection (MOI) of 1 for 1 h in DMEM medium supplemented with 2% BSA. cells were washed with DMEM once and then grown with DMEM supplemented with 0.2% BSA and 1 g/ml N-p-tosyl-1-phenyl alanine chloromethyl ketone (TPCK) NP was immunoprecipitated using anti-NP monoclonal antibody. immunofluorescence microscopy After infection or transfection for 24 h, A549 cells were fixed with 2% paraformaldehyde for 30 min at room temperature.
